channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Simone Fox Koob
item.description: Victoria and the rest of Australia continue to battle the impacts of COVID-19.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Victoria records 12 new COVID-19 cases as state flags easing of restrictions next week; Trump tests negative as Australian death toll jumps to 899

item.description: Some of his best work
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Andrew Dyson

item.description: Illustrations by the artist from The Age.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Golding

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: NSW Premier Gladys Berejiklian is staring down any threats to her leadership after stunning revelations she was in a five-year relationship with a disgraced MP accused of corruption.
item.title: NSW Politics LIVE updates: Gladys Berejiklian stands firm as Premier as 'close, personal relationship' with Daryl Maguire revealed at ICAC hearing

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, October 13, 2020

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Day eight of the campaign sees the LNP in southeast Queensland, with Deb Frecklington to hold a fundraiser with the Prime Minister, while Labor has headed north again to woo regional voters.
item.title: POLL CALL Day 8: Donations in the spotlight as electorate 'fractures'

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: Telstra chairman John Mullen has called for a simpler executive pay model after several key leaders missed out on $758,000 worth of incentives last financial year.
item.title: Telstra chair calls for simpler pay model after execs lose $750k in bonuses

item.dc:creator: Nathanael Cooper
item.description: The pop rock duo lead the pack with eight nominations ahead of Tame Impala's seven.
item.title: Lime Cordiale dominates ARIA award nominations

item.dc:creator: Michael Gleeson
item.description: Colin Carter says criticism of the Cats and their finals record in recent years overlooks the fact this is a completely reconstructed side from the one that last won a flag.
item.title: 'Miraculous': Cats president proud of rebuild on the run

item.description: Made stingy by the pandemic and gun-shy by the election, US companies are banking their cash.
item.title: Rainy day: Corporate America puts $2.8 trillion in bank in run-up to election

item.description: Acting Assistant Commissioner Allan Adams there was clearly someone who was expecting to receive the cash, and given the amount of drugs seized it is fair to suggest there was a further distribution network ready and waiting to take delivery.
item.title: Police find record $3.8 million cash hidden in truck, then discover 130,000 hits of meth at Perth house

item.dc:creator: Paul Sakkal
item.description: The state's 14-day average increased slightly as authorities investigate whether Royal Melbourne Hospital patients had been picking up COVID-19 during their stay.
item.title: Victoria records 12 additional cases of coronavirus, one death

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: CBA chair Catherine Livingstone has told shareholders simplifying the bank's operations is paying off.
item.title: CBA chair says back-to-basics banking helped balance sheet

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: The investigation revolves around a fundraising event in August.
item.title: 'Crisis would be an understatement': Frecklington denies referral to election watchdog

item.description: Join our team – Economics Editor Ross Gittins, Chief Political Correspondent David Crowe, Senior Economics Correspondent Shane Wright and National Editor Tory Maguire – live today at this virtual event as they discuss the fallout from the budget.
item.title: Breaking down the budget with our experts

item.description: US President Donald Trump's White House doctor says Trump has tested negative for COVID-19 on consecutive days using a newer rapid test from Abbott laboratories.
item.title: Trump tests negative to COVID-19 on consecutive days: White House doctor

item.dc:creator: Hamish Hastie
item.description: Gold Road Resources boss Duncan Gibbs said the iron ore sector was starting to recruit from gold and nickel mines.
item.title: WA's gold miners divided on McGowan's hard border

item.description: Follow news and events as they happen.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: The land at the centre of the $218 million redevelopment was valued by the state government at just $1, with the government initially planning to contribute $50 million in site works.
item.title: McGowan tips more cash into Stokes-Forrest East Perth Power Station redevelopment

item.dc:creator: Cameron Atfield
item.description: This Queensland election campaign, Brisbane Times is not only reporting on the news of the day, we’re also asking questions on your behalf. Directly.
item.title: Ask a Reporter: Does the Prime Minister's entry into the campaign help or hurt the LNP?

item.description: Disney is redoubling its push to become a global streaming giant like Netflix, is shaking up its operations to refocus on the thriving Disney+ business.
item.title: Disney shakes up business to focus on streaming

item.dc:creator: Alex Druce
item.description: The ASX200 rose 1% at Tuesday's open, and was a whisker away from 6200 and its highest intraday peak since the rout of the market in February and March.
item.title: ASX up 1% and near post-pandemic high; Banks, Telstra surge

item.description: Donald Trump promises that he will once again build "the greatest economy in the world." The problem is he never did in the first place.
item.title: Trump's economic record should have voters sceptical

item.description: Video and telephone conferencing give a false sense of security as many patients are poor historians and the doctor is hampered by the lack of clinical clues.
item.title: Telehealth no substitute for real doctors and care

item.description: The United Nations warns that many regions are becoming uninhabitable as global warming increases floods, fires and other natural disasters.
item.title: 'An uninhabitable hell': UN says climate change 'doubled the rate' of disasters

item.description: Zuckerberg backs down on previous free-speech argument as he orders Facebook and Instagram to remove Holocaust denial and distortion posts.
item.title: Zuckerberg says Facebook will now ban Holocaust denial posts

item.description: Billionaire financier Leon Black paid at least $US50 million to Jeffrey Epstein for advice long after most had deserted him, according to a New York Times report.
item.title: The Wall Street billionaire who stood by Jeffrey Epstein

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: Boris Johnson announced three-tier lockdown system to tackle coronavirus infections but UK's Chief Medical Officer Chris Whitty says 'I am not confident, nor is anyone confident' that it will work.
item.title: England keeps restaurants, schools and shops open under local lockdown plan

item.dc:creator: Fergus Hunter
item.description: The initiative targets people deemed to be at high risk of offending and has been criticised for its disproportionate focus on Aboriginal and young people.
item.title: Controversial police program successfully reducing crime: report

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: Democrats on the Senate committee argue that Supreme Court nominee Amy Coney Barrett is "a judicial torpedo" aimed at abortion, gay marriage and Obamacare.
item.title: 'This is a sham': Democrats, Republicans spar at Supreme Court hearing

item.description: British Airways has abruptly replaced CEO Alex Cruz after more than four years on the job as part of a broad shake-up as the COVID-19 pandemic pummels airlines around the world.
item.title: British Airways replaces CEO as company fights for survival

item.description: Wall Street's main indexes rose for a fourth straight session on optimism that a deal for a coronavirus relief package would eventually be reached.
item.title: ASX set to jump as Wall Street rally gains steam

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: Australia Post hired a leading public relations consultant as it tried to justify less frequent deliveries, while the CEO spent about $300,000 on corporate credit cards.
item.title: Australia Post hired $3000-a-day reputation manager as it wound back deliveries

item.description: Azerbaijan and ethnic Armenian forces have accused each other of launching new attacks in and around Nagorno-Karabakh.
item.title: Nagorno-Karabakh ceasefire teeters on the brink of collapse

item.description: EU foreign ministers have backed a Franco-German plan to impose sanctions on Russians suspected of poisoning Kremlin critic Alexei Navalny.
item.title: EU agrees to sanction Russians over Navalny poisoning

item.description: Cardinal George Pell was cleared earlier this year of sexual abuse charges in Australia after spending 13 months in prison.
item.title: Pell returns to the Vatican for a private audience with Pope Francis

item.dc:creator: Darren Gray
item.description: Explosives maker Orica is tipped to have a better year this financial year, after COVID-19 hit mining in some countries in the 2020-21 financial year.
item.title: Orica unveils $170m of significant items, set for 'better year'

item.dc:creator: Peter Hartcher
item.description: Concerns about China's growing influence in the Asia-Pacific are expediting the creation of international allegiances, unified by their wariness of the authoritarian state.
item.title: Western world waking up to Beijing's bullying

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: Katarina Carroll told the court the reduced sentence given to Senior Constable Neil Punchard, who leaked a DV survivor's address to her ex-partner, "has the tendency to erode public confidence" in the police force.
item.title: Police Commissioner argues against officer's reduced sentence

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: The Queensland LNP has already pulled in more than double the value of donations than Labor since the start of the year.
item.title: LNP looks to top up election war chest with $1500-a-head luncheon

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: What was this famous US court decision – and what would happen if it were overturned?
item.title: What was Roe v Wade and why is everyone talking about it now?

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: The Wallabies' thrilling draw with the All Blacks has put rugby back on Australia's sporting map. Now RA interim chief executive Rob Clarke wants to capitalise on the momentum in negotiations for a new broadcast deal.
item.title: 'Something to believe in': Wallabies love comes at perfect time for code

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: As they prepare to return to Queensland for a shot at another grand final, Josh Papalii and his Raiders teammates insist the saga has brought them closer together.
item.title: The hospital scares that led Raiders trio to reject flu vaccine

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: The ACTU secretary says agreement was reached in two of five industrial working groups but Industrial Relations Minister Christian Porter has cast doubt on the union's view.
item.title: Be on 'high alert', McManus tells workers as government readies industrial reform

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: Of all the people Tyrone May felt he let down in an episode described by a magistrate as "morally reprehensible", the former Penrith supremo was top of the list.
item.title: The Phil Gould court reference that broke Panthers star during sex tape trial

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Knight
item.description: Crown's 10 per cent shareholder Blackstone appears to be positioning itself to have an option to take a controlling interest in the casino group.
item.title: As inquiry nears close, Crown has a corporate stalker

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Tuesday, October 13

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Australia's largest gig economy outfit is extending its global footprint as the pandemic forces more people to look for a way to supplement their income.
item.title: Airtasker uses COVID boost to launch into New Zealand and Singapore

item.description: Kevin Rudd's outrage at what he sees as the destructive influence of the Murdoch empire was not so evident while he was a government minister.
item.title: Rudd has become Murdoch's accuser, but once he was his cheerleader

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: The government's plan to set performance benchmarks for super funds could lead to less infrastructure investment and damage returns, IFM Investors say.
item.title: Super funds, Labor warn of 'catastrophic' risk of benchmarking funds
